section: CONTRACT PERIOD means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Parties and terminating on May 31, 2016 unless sooner terminated under this Agreement. b) SERVICES PERIOD means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Parties and terminating on May 31, 2014 unless sooner terminated under this Agreement.
explanation: There is an inconsistency between the CONTRACT PERIOD and SERVICES PERIOD. The contract period ends in 2016, but the services period ends in 2014. This means that the contract is still active but there will be no services performed.

section: Past due cash payments (i.e., payments due more than thirty (30) days after Berkshires receipt of the applicable invoice) shall bear interest at the rate of one (1%) percent per month.
explanation: Section 5 states that interest will be applied to past due payments after 30 days of reciept of the applicable invoice, but Section 4 discusses the payment schedule with specific dates where 4 payments of $90,000 are due each year. It is unclear if section 5 applies to all payments.

section: Auriemma represents and warrants to Berkshire that: (i) Auriemma has full authority to enter into and perform under this Agreement subject only to approval by the University of Connecticut department of athletics and consulting office;
explanation: Auriemma says that he has full authority to enter into the agreement, but that it is subject to approval from the University of Connecticut department. This creates ambiguity about whether Auriemma truly has the authority to make the contract.
